meanings.sent1: I will be recataloging my book collection this weekend.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is recataloging the library books for easier access.
meanings.sent3: Recataloging my closet feels like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her memory works like recataloging old files, bringing forgotten moments to light.
meanings.sent5: Recataloging the information made it easier to find what I needed.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing items in a catalog again.
meanings.sent1: The recataloging of the museum artifacts was a tedious task.
meanings.sent2: Recataloging the inventory helped streamline the warehouse operations.
meanings.sent3: The recataloging process turned into a fun puzzle game.
meanings.sent4: The recataloging of the documents shed light on missing records.
meanings.sent5: The recataloging project improved the efficiency of the catalog system.
